low_health.text: Your health is low—eat food or find shelter.
Avoid combat until you heal up.
Golden apples provide extra healing and absorption.
Build a quick dirt shelter to regenerate health safely.
Keep cooked food in your hotbar for emergencies.
Regeneration potions can save you in critical moments.

low_food.text: You're hungry—hunt animals or harvest crops for food.
Cooked food restores more hunger than raw.
Bread is easy to make with wheat from tall grass seeds.
Kill passive mobs like pigs, cows, or chickens for meat.
Fishing is a reliable food source near water.
Carrots and potatoes can be found in villages or zombie drops.
Keep your hunger bar above 18 to enable health regeneration.

night_risk.text: Night is dangerous—seek shelter or place torches.
Monsters spawn in darkness; light level 7+ prevents spawns.
Sleep in a bed to skip the night and set your spawn point.
Build a simple shelter before sunset to stay safe.
Carry a shield to block skeleton arrows at night.
If caught outside, dig a quick hole and cover yourself.

mining_mode.text: Mining deep? Watch for lava and keep torches handy.
Always mine with a buddy or mark your path with torches on one side.
Diamond ore is most common at Y-levels -64 to -16.
Don't dig straight down or straight up—you might fall in lava or drown in gravel.
Iron pickaxe or better is needed to mine diamonds.
Bring water buckets underground to deal with lava safely.
Branch mining at Y -59 is efficient for finding diamonds.
Listen for monster sounds—caves nearby mean danger and loot.

near_resource.text: Resource under your crosshair—consider mining it.
Use the right tool for the job to mine faster and save durability.
Fortune enchantment increases drops from ores like diamonds and coal.
Silk Touch preserves the block itself—useful for ores and glass.
Coal and iron are essential early-game resources.
Mark rare ore locations with torches or signs for later.

exploring.text: Exploring? Note your base coordinates to avoid getting lost.
Press F3 to see your coordinates and current biome.
Build tall pillars or place torches to mark your path.
Craft a compass to always point toward your world spawn.
Villages, temples, and strongholds contain valuable loot.
Different biomes offer unique resources and structures.
Bring food, tools, and a bed when exploring far from home.
Maps help you navigate but require a cartography table to expand.

combat.text: Keep your distance and use a bow against tough enemies.
Block with a shield to reduce damage—especially from creeper explosions.
Critical hits deal extra damage—jump and attack while falling.
Enchantments like Sharpness and Protection boost combat effectiveness.
Retreat and regenerate health if outnumbered.
Use terrain to your advantage—high ground and chokepoints help.
Creepers explode when close—sprint away or use a shield.
Axes deal more damage per hit but have slower attack speed than swords.

building.text: Start with a simple shelter—4 walls, a door, and torches.
Mix block types for more interesting builds—wood, stone, and glass work well together.
Use slabs and stairs to add detail and depth to structures.
Plan your layout before building large structures.
Light up your base inside and out to prevent mob spawns.
Organize storage with labeled chests for easy access.
Furnaces, crafting tables, and chests should be easily accessible.
Scaffolding makes building tall structures much easier.
Use trapdoors, fences, and walls for unique architectural details.

enchanting.text: Build an enchanting table with 2 diamonds, 4 obsidian, and a book.
Surround your enchanting table with bookshelves for higher-level enchantments.
Level 30 enchantments require 15 bookshelves around the table.
Combine enchanted items in an anvil to preserve the best enchantments.
Grindstones remove enchantments and return some experience.
Mending keeps your tools repaired by collecting experience orbs.

farming.text: Plant seeds near water for faster crop growth.
Bone meal instantly grows crops—craft it from skeleton bones.
Wheat, carrots, and potatoes are easy starter crops.
Breed animals with their favorite food to expand your farm.
Fences keep animals contained and safe from mobs.
Villagers can trade crops for emeralds and other valuable items.
Automatic farms with hoppers and redstone save time.

nether.text: The Nether is dangerous—bring fire resistance potions.
Build a safe portal room to protect your Nether entry point.
Don't attack Zombie Piglin unless you want to fight the whole group.
Ancient debris (for Netherite) spawns deep in the Nether around Y 15.
Nether fortresses contain Blaze spawners needed for brewing.
Beds explode in the Nether—use them strategically to mine or as traps.
Gold armor reduces Piglin aggression in the Nether.

redstone.text: Redstone powers mechanisms like doors, pistons, and lamps.
Use repeaters to extend redstone signals beyond 15 blocks.
Comparators measure container fullness and power levels.
Pressure plates and buttons are simple ways to activate redstone.
Redstone torches invert signals—on becomes off and vice versa.
Hoppers move items between chests and can be locked with redstone.
